instruction: What kinds of spectrum were used to identify the viability of Sophora japonica seeds?
Output: The related study used visible spectrum and nir spectrum to identify the viability of Sophora japonica seeds.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used to identify the viability of Sophora japonica seeds?
Output: Four different preprocessing methods were compared to identify the viability of Sophora japonica seeds. These methods included ZC-FD pretreatment, LT pretreatment, NB + LT, and SOFM.

instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the performance of the models to identify the viability of Sophora japonica seeds and how far can this metric go?
Output: The metric chosen to evaluate the performance of the models to identify the viability of Sophora japonica seeds was the Pearson correlation coefficient method. This metric can go as far as establishing a strong correlation between the spectral changes and the components of the seeds.

instruction: How did the researchers utilize machine learning algorithms and deep learning models to identify the viability of Sophora japonica seeds?
Output: The researchers utilized machine learning algorithms and deep learning models to identify the viability of Sophora japonica seeds by collecting hyperspectral data of the seeds in different viability grades and imbibition states. They compared the effects of swelling and aging on the content of water, protein, starch, fat, and total sugar, and established correlation analysis. Among the machine learning algorithms, naive bayes (NB), self-organizing feature mapping algorithm (SOFM), and support vector machine (SVM) were used. On the scale of deep learning, convolutional neural networks (CNN) and long short-term memory (LSTM) were applied to model the one-dimensional spectral and two-dimensional image data. The image-based deep learning model performed the best among the three models, achieving a recognition accuracy above 90%. To optimize the hyperparameters, a particle swarm optimization algorithm (PSO) was proposed, which increased the recognition rate up to 99.73% and improved the convergence speed. This study demonstrated the potential of deep learning combined with spectral or image data in identifying the viability of Sophora japonica seeds.

instruction: How did the researchers compare the performance of the image-based deep learning model with other models in identifying the viability of Sophora japonica seeds?
Output: The researchers compared the performance of the image-based deep learning model with other models by using different machine learning algorithms such as naive bayes (NB), self-organizing feature mapping algorithm (SOFM), and support vector machine (SVM). They also used deep learning models such as convolutional neural networks (CNN) and long short-term memory (LSTM). After comparing the three models, they found that the image-based deep learning model performed the best, with a recognition accuracy above 90%.
